title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 43-2.10 - Investigation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 43-2.10 - Investigation

State Regulations

The department official shall review and verify information received on applications, as required. Documents, personal observation, personal and collateral interviews and contacts, reports, correspondence and conferences are means of verification of information supplied. When information is sought from collateral sources other than public records or sources designated by the applicant on the application form, the department will inform the applicant/participant or his/her representative of what information is desired, why it is needed and how it will be used. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
43-2.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
